H0.text: two main types of research methods used in psychology. Experimental

H1.text: two main types of research methods used in psychology. Statistical

H2.text: two main types of research methods used in psychology. Clinical

H3.text: two main types of research methods used in psychology. qualitative

A4.text: Quantitative psychological research lends itself to the statistical testing of hypotheses.

A5.text: Qualitative research is often designed to answer questions about the thoughts, feelings, and behaviors of individuals.

A6.text: Qualitative research is a type of research that aims to gather and analyse non-numerical (descriptive) data in order to gain an understanding of individuals' social reality, including understanding their attitudes, beliefs, and motivation.

A7.text: Qualitative methods include ethnography, grounded theory, discourse analysis, and interpretative phenomenological analysis.
